meanings.definition: Enzymes that catalyze the epimerization of a compound.
meanings.sent1: Epimerases are important enzymes in the body.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study epimerases to understand their role in chemical reactions.
meanings.sent3: The epimerases at the lab were so efficient, they could switch compounds in seconds!
meanings.sent4: Her ability to adapt to different situations was like that of epimerases, changing rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The classroom demonstration vividly showed how epimerases alter compounds.

meanings.definition: The process of converting one epimer into another.
meanings.sent1: Understanding epimerases involves knowing how they convert one form to another.
meanings.sent2: During the experiment, the epimerases transformed the molecule effectively.
meanings.sent3: The epimerases' party trick was turning left-handed gloves into right-handed ones!
meanings.sent4: The market fluctuation was like epimerases, constantly changing direction.
meanings.sent5: The magical wand worked like epimerases, magically switching objects.
